faculty.name: Dr. B.S. Manjunath
faculty.bio: Dr. Manjunath leads the Vision Research Lab at UCSB, focusing on computer vision, image processing, and machine learning applications.
faculty.research: Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Image Processing

graduateStudents.name: Md Awsafur Rahman
graduateStudents.bio: Doing research on Intersection between Computer Vision, NLP and Audio Processing.
graduateStudents.research: Multi-modal LLM, Media Forensics, Generative AI

graduateStudents.name: Raphael Ruschel
graduateStudents.bio: My research at UCSB has focused on developing transformer-based architectures that model human activities with significantly improved accuracy. I've created dynamic scene-graph generation algorithms that achieved 400%+ recall improvement in real-world scenarios and engineered temporally consistent tracking pipelines that doubled temporal recall on the Action Genome dataset. I've also engineered multi-camera synthetic data generation systems using Unity Engine, featuring parametrized human models with skeletal animations and physics-based interactions. This work has enhanced our ability to train robust models for production environments. Beyond research, I've mentored over 500 students as a Graduate Teaching Assistant in Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Digital Image Processing courses, earning the Outstanding Teaching Assistant award three times.

researchers.name: Chandrakanth Gudavalli
researchers.bio: I am broadly enthusiastic towards machine learning that mimics capabilities of human intelligence. My specific areas of interest include Structure from Motion, Image Registration, Human Pattern of Life Modelling, Multimodal Anomaly Detection, Image forensics, Deepfake synthesis, Signal Processing/Vision based malware detection, and most importantly MLOps.

researchers.name: Connor Levenson
researchers.bio: I am broadly interested in intelligence, whether natural or artificial. I am also interested in how machine learning can accelerate scientific research across different domains.
